src:
KPK Periksa 9 Saksi Tersangka Bupati Indramayu non aktif Supendi
07 Nov 2019, 15:40 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Periksa 9 Saksi Tersangka Bupati Indramayu non aktif Supendi

KBRN, Jakarta : Penyidik Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) dijadwalkam memanggil sejumlah saksi terkait kasus dugaan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) suap tpengaturan proyek di lingkungan Pemerintah Kabupaten (Pemkab)  Indramayu, Jawa Barat, Tahun 2019.
Kabiro Humas KPK Febri Diansyah kepada wartawan di Jakarta menjelaskan bahwa sedikitnya ada 9 orang  saksi itu dijadwalkan dipanggil sekaligus dimintai keterangannnya untuk tersangka Supendi (SP) Bupati Indramayu non aktif yang sekarang sudah ditahan KPK. 
“KPK melakukan pemeriksaan terhadap 9 orang saksi terkait dugaan tindak pidana korupsi (Tipikor) suap pengaturan proyek di lingkungan Pemerintah Kabupaten Indramayu Tahun 2019," kata Febri Diansyah di Gedung KPK Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Febri mengatakan kesembilan saksi yang dipanggil penyidik  KPK tersebut masing-masing adalah  Direktur BPR Karya Remaja Indramayu Sugiyanto, Sudirjo seorang sopir, Haidar Samsayail ajudan Supendi, staf Dinas PUPR Kabupaten Indramayu Ferry Mulyadi.
Berikutnya adalah saksi Masdi dari unsur swasta, perwakilan CV Karya Bima Iin Dewi Kuraesin, perwakilan PT Sumber Mega Utama Rudy Indra Prasetyo, perwakilan CV Inka Abadi Sunarti, dan perwakilan PT Alfindo Wijaya Mandiri Noory Hidayat.
Penyidii KPK dalam kasus ini juga telah menetapkan sebanyak 3 orang kainnya sebagai tersangka, diantaranya Kepala Dinas (Kadis) Pekerjaan Umum dan Penataan Ruang (PUPR) Kabupaten Indramayu Omarsyah (OMS), Kepala Bidang (Kabid) Jalan di Dinas PUPR Kabupaten Indramayu Wempy Triyono (WT) dan seorang tersangka dari pihak swasta yaitu Carsa AS (CAS) .
Penyidik KPK menduga tersangka Supendi, Omarsyah, dan Wempy disangkakan sebagai pihak penerima suap. Sedangkan tersangka Carsa disangkakan sebagai pihak pemberi suap atau penyuap. 
KPK meyakini tersangka Corsa diduga telah memberikan sejumlah uang kepada Supendi dan pejabat Dinas PUPR. Pemberian uang itu diduga merupakan bagian dari “commitment fee” sebesar 5 hingga  7 persen dari keseluruhan nilai proyek.
text:
KPK Investigates 9 active witnesses of the District Head of Indramayu inactive Supendi
Nov 7 2019, 15:40 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Investigates 9 active witnesses of the District Head of Indramayu inactive Supendi

KBRN, Jakarta: Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) investigators are scheduled to call a number of witnesses related to alleged cases of Corruption (Tipikor) bribery for project arrangements in the District Government (Pemkab) of Indramayu, West Java, 2019.
KPK Head of Public Relations, Febri Diansyah, told reporters in Jakarta that at least 9 witnesses were scheduled to be summoned at the same time to be questioned for the suspect Supendi (SP) of the non-active Regent of Indramayu who is now being held by the KPK.
"The Corruption Eradication Commission conducted an examination of 9 witnesses related to allegations of corruption (Tipikor) bribery of project arrangements within the Indramayu Regency Government in 2019," said Febri Diansyah at the Jakarta KPK Building, Thursday (11/07/2019).
Febri said the nine witnesses summoned by the KPK investigators were respectively the Director of BPR Karya Remaja Indramayu Sugiyanto, Sudirjo a driver, Haidar Samsayail aide Supendi, staff of the Indramayu Regency PUPR Office Ferry Mulyadi.
Next were Masdi's witnesses from the private sector, CV Karya Bima Iin Dewi Kuraesin, PT Sumber Mega Utama representative Rudy Indra Prasetyo, CV Inka Abadi Sunarti, and PT Alfindo Wijaya Mandiri representative Noory Hidayat.
The KPK investigator in this case has also set 3 of his cloths as suspects, including the Head of the Public Works (Kadis) Office and Spatial Planning (PUPR) of the Indramayu Omarsyah Regency (CSO), the Head of the Road Sector (Kabid) of the Road in the PUPR Office of Indramayu Wempy Triyono ( WT) and a suspect from the private sector namely Carsa AS (CAS).
KPK investigators suspect the suspects Supendi, Omarsyah and Wempy are suspected of being bribes. While Carsa is suspected of being a bribe-giving party.
The KPK believes that the suspect Corsa has allegedly given some money to Supendi and PUPR officials. Provision of money is thought to be part of the "commitment fee" of 5 to 7 percent of the total value of the project.
